page.title: 10 Suffolk Farm Project
page.content: Otley School is linked with Grange Farm Otley owned by Mr Russell Ling. The idea of the project is to enable the children to visit a local farm to study the many and varied aspects of agriculture. Mr Ling has a fairly small farm growing wheat, barley and winter beans. In addition he keeps pigs, cattle, chickens and ducks. He also has a few horses. There is an old farmhouse which dates from the 17th century and some very old buildings including a timbered oak barn. Mr Ling lives in a modern farmhouse. The children visit the farm 4 times a year. Mr Ling talks about his work and his crops. He allows the children to handle the animals and to see all the machinery in action. Rather surprisingly in a rural area many children know very little about farming.
